content:
Netizen contribution
In the early morning of July 6, at the ticket gate of Nanjing Railway Station
A woman suddenly broke down emotionally and cried and shouted, while constantly showing her mobile phone to the people around her.
Because the woman mainly spoke in dialect, the contributor could only vaguely hear sporadic words such as "what a pity", "the case has been delayed again and again", and "lamenting about society".
It is worth mentioning that from the beginning of the woman's collapse, two men stood next to her. They were originally thought to be ordinary passengers, but later when the woman was helped to sit down, one of the plainclothes men took out a law enforcement recorder and started filming.

Suzhou's martial law today:
Picture 1: A man in black sits on each pier under the flyover
Picture 2: All vehicles on the flyover are blocked by a police car 200 meters away
Picture 3/4: For an hour in the afternoon, some sections of the road were blocked, and pedestrians were not allowed to walk, but electric vehicles and bicycles were not allowed to pass.
